interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Man in the High Castle
Review Date: 2017/01/10
Categories: Suspense, Drama, Historical, Military and War
Product Description: ['After giving Joe the film, Juliana is forced to flee the fury of the Resistance while embarking on a new path to save her home from destruction. Joe confronts his absent father in Berlin, who is not as he seems. Smith wrestles with what to do about his ill son. Frank takes a gamble with his life in a bid to save Ed. Tagomi\'s life is turned upside down by his "travel" to an alternative world.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Dan Percival', 'Colin Bucksey', 'Dan Sackheim', 'David Petrarca', 'John Fawcett', 'Paul Holahan', 'Karyn Kusama', 'Alex Zakrzewski', 'Chris Long'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'David W. Zucker', 'Frank Spotnitz', 'Isa Dick Hackett', 'Christopher Tricarico', 'Stewart Mackinnon', 'Chrtistian Baute', 'Jace Richdale', 'Richard Heus', 'Dan Percival', 'Jordan Sheehan', 'Kalen Egan', 'Erin Smith'], 'Starring': ['Alexa Davalos', 'Rupert Evans', 'Luke Kleintank']}
Review Text: I love this show!  This is a series everyone should watch.  Especially the thirty and under group of Americans. The opening gives me chill bumps when I see the German swastica and the Japanese Flag in where we know to be the United States of America.  We American s take our freedom for granted too often.  Keep the shows coming!
Review Title: Everyone Needs to See Ths Series!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Good Wife
Drama
['Pushing aside the betrayal and crushing public humiliation caused by her husband, Peter, Alicia Florrick starts over by pursuing her original career as a defense attorney.  As a junior associate at a prestigious Chicago law firm, she joins her longtime friend, former law school classmate and firm partner Will Gardner, who is interested in rekindling their former relationship.']
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rosemary Rodriguez', 'Michael Zinberg', 'Brooke Kennedy', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Jim McKay', 'Frederick E.O. Toye', 'Robert King', 'Matt Shakman', 'Nelson McCormick']}
I just started this series and it it hard to stop watching it!  I love the main character Alicia.  My next  favorite is Zack, her son.  Both of them are so smart and yet, vulnerable.  Strong women will love this.  If you want to be a strong woman you will love it too.  If men would like to be better men, they can pick up a few pointers from this series as well.  Enjoy!
Very good program
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bobby Quinn'], 'Starring': ['Johnny Carson', 'Ed McMahon', 'Bill Clinton'], 'Studio': ['Respond2 Entertainment']}
Carson was a one of a kind, never to be duplicated.  I use to watch this program with my parents as a child.  Never a dull one.  You will like this video.
Great memories!
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sydney Pollack'], 'Producers': ['Joe Wizan'], 'Starring': ['Robert Redford', 'Will Geer', 'Stefan Gierasch'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']}
Classic Redford movie.  A must watch for a fan of adventure and Redford.  It is the type of movie you watch several times and always see something new.
Classic!
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joel Schumacher'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lloyd Webber'], 'Starring': ['Gerard Butler', 'Emmy Rossum', 'Patrick Wilson'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']}
My granddaughter and I have watched this together many times.  Such a bittersweet love story and beautiful music!  Love it!
Best Musical!
Breaking Bad
Suspense, Drama
['All bad things must come to an end.']
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Michelle MacLaren', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan']}
The first series we have watched entirely.  I had to purchase to finish!  I bought it for my husband really.  Great program but not for children!
The best!
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rosemary Rodriguez', 'Michael Zinberg', 'Brooke Kennedy', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Jim McKay', 'Frederick E.O. Toye', 'Robert King', 'Matt Shakman', 'Nelson McCormick'], 'Studio': ['CBS']}
I always look forward to my special time watching this series.  The main character, Alicia, is smart, caring, and is wonderfully portrayed.  The supporting characters are all very dynamic and each have their own entertaining aspect.  The female actors in this series are the best I have seen I. A series.  Enjoy!
Excellent!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Fink', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Bobby Roth', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'John Terlesky', 'Sanford Bookstaver', 'Colin Bucksey', 'Matt Shakman', 'John Scott', 'Randy Zisk'], 'Starring': ['Madeleine Stowe', 'Emily VanCamp', 'Gabriel Mann'], 'Studio': ['ABC']}
I have become addicted to this Hampton tale.  If you like beautiful homes and elaborate schemes this is for you.
What a surprise!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeff Nichols'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Green', 'Aaron Ryder', 'Lisa Maria Falcone'], 'Starring': ['Matthew McConaughey', 'Tye Sheridan', 'Sam Shepard'], 'Studio': ['tribecashortlist']}
Pretty good movie.  The boys in the movie are great and the theme of innocence and trust takes you back to another time.
Worth a watch
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Oliver Hirschbiegel'], 'Producers': ["Eoin O'Callaghan", 'Stephen Wright'], 'Starring': ['Liam Neeson', 'James Nesbitt', 'Anamaria Marinca'], 'Studio': ['IFC Films']}
I thought this would be good considering Liam Neeson was in it.  Wrong!  I made myself finish the movie just to make sure all of it was terrible.  A waste of time.
Heaven or He'll to watch?
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Byrne', 'John Strickland', 'Jon Jones', 'Michael Keillor'], 'Producers': ['Jeremy Piven', 'Andrew Davies', 'Chrissy Skinns', 'Kate Lewis', 'Rebecca Eaton'], 'Starring': ['Aisling Loftus', "Frances O'Connor", 'Gregory Fitoussi'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
The characters are very interesting and appealing.  The costumes and set are awesome.  Very realistic and entertaining.  I will continue to watch this series.
Very good!
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alexander Payne'], 'Producers': ['Albert Berger', 'Doug Mankoff', 'George Parra', 'Neil Tabatznik', 'Julie M. Thompson', 'Ron Yerxa'], 'Starring': ['Bruce Dern', 'Will Forte'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']}
A depressing film about a subject most baby boomers are familiar with  Alzheimer's and dementia.  The caring sons try to make their father see reality but it only breaks his heart.  The boys try to make everything right but it never will be.  The youngest son finally sees the light and does what it takes to bring some peace and dignity to his fathers life.  The best scene is when the other tells her relatives to ______, themselves!  :-).
Good ending, but slow.

This was a show that was repulsive in every area.  From the characters appearance, in the way they talk to each other and where the story seemed to be going.  Not subjects I want to be spending my time on.
Not good

description: After giving Joe the film, Juliana is forced to flee the fury of the Resistance while embarking on a new path to save her home from destruction. Joe confronts his absent father in Berlin, who is not as he seems. Smith wrestles with what to do about his ill son. Frank takes a gamble with his life in a bid to save Ed. Tagomi's life is turned upside down by his "travel" to an alternative world.
